Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2011 08:06PM TokyoSing wrote: Jeaniem, Hopefully, you are right that it is a benign cyst that is causing the retracted nipple. But I would still go to your doctor and have this checked.  I also had lumpy breasts. After 10 years of diagnostic mammograms, I noticed that my left nipple had retracted.  Ultrasound found a 2 cm lobular carcinoma.

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 06:05AM TokyoSing wrote: TexasDonna,  the oncotype dx is a special "assay". It is not, as far as  I know, part of the usual tests your oncologist performs.  The pathologist has to send your tissue samples to Genomic Health Inc in Redwood City where they determine your recurrence score based on a panel of  21 genes in the submitted tissue.  My insurance paid for it, otherwise it costs more than $3500.  As Debbie stated, in the early days, this test was only for node negative BC cases, now they will take tissues from cases with up to 3 node involvement.  I hope this helps!
Posts.Title: Stage, Grade, & OncotypeDx texasdonna Lee7

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2010 05:19PM - edited Aug 20, 2013 05:49AM by TokyoSing Hi Shelly, I also had a mastectomy with no reconstruction nearly 7 months ago.  Waiting is terrible.  I used the time to learn more about BC, about alternative treatments and care. I made a list of what I did not understand, so I could ask at my next appointment.  My doctor also had me doing gentle stretches about a week into my surgery.  That and walking (first in a mall hiding my drains in a purse) was crucial to my full recovery.  In 6 weeks, I was back on my yoga mat feeling like my old self again.

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2010 10:15PM TokyoSing wrote: I had a single mastectomy, no radiation, no chemo.  I got my first silicone form (Amoena) at 5 weeks.  I was overjoyed.  The fluffie I was wearing never stayed put.  If you go to Nordstrom, make an appointment so that the fitter is there waiting for you. They can be very good.  They filled in all my forms and  contacted my insurance company.  They even sewed pockets in my favorite spanx bras for free. After seven months, I am getting a second form:  a light weight silique that I hope to wear in the shelf bra of my yoga tanks.
Posts.Title: How long does it take to get a prosthesis singletona80 Barbaramess20

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2011 09:10AM TokyoSing wrote: Ladies, I can vouch for the Silique comfort Lite form (part silicone, part microbeads) with a fabric back.  They are considerably lighter than a silicone form because of the microbeads.  I find the all- microbead form bunch up and don't look/feel as good a silicone one. I have had pockets put into my spanx bras. Maybe you can have them sewn into your Victoria Secrets bras.
Posts.Title: Keep mastectomy bra from riding up puddingirl84 Kicks

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2011 03:41AM TokyoSing wrote: I also had a single mastectomy with no reconstruction in February. I did not need pain medication after leaving the hospital on the 3rd day.  My surgeon started me gentle arm lifts the 2nd week.  6 weeks after surgery, I was on a flight from Tokyo  to Boston to get a 2nd opinion at Dana Farber.  My oncologist said I could resume all activities in moderation.  I signed up for the 1st yoga class that was available and have not looked back.
Posts.Title: Prep and after unilateral mastectomy Jelson terry54

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2010 11:54PM TokyoSing wrote: I also like front closure bras with underwires.  My favorite is Spanx.  What I did was buy my spanx bras at Nordstrom and they put the pockets in for me for free.  While it is true that Nordstrom only carries Amoena forms, once you have your Amoena size, you can call a place like Truekare ( who carries Silique) and they can tell you what size to order. I like my new Silique MBT light weight form which is in three layers, and fits in my yoga tank tops as well.

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2011 03:36AM TokyoSing wrote: Hi Everybody, you are aware that Jane Plant is ethnic Chinese - that's probably why her system cannot tolerate dairy.  Like most of us 1.3 B and up people of Chinese descent, not only are we lactose intolerant, dairy probably causes all kinds of inflammation in our system.    We moved to Tokyo 14 months ago, after spending the last decade in the US.  Japan has, statistically, the lowest rate of breast cancer in the world. We all know about the healthy diet, the green tea.  Today, I decided to use my pedometer to track how much I walked. (After more than 40 years of being attached to a car: my parents gave me a Buick when I went to College in 1970, and I have never been without a car until now). So back to my walking.  This morning, I walked to the subway to take a train to my yoga class and back.  This afternoon, I took the subway to a music studio for a rehearsal and tonight, my husband and I took the subway to dinner and back.  All in all,I clocked more than  8000 steps or 5 Km ( 3 miles). Pretty painless way to exercise, don't you think?
Posts.Title: Why don't Chinese women get breast cancer? MCTHO
